a rigid transformation (also called Euclidean transformation or Euclidean isometry) is a geometric transformation of a Euclidean space that preserves the Euclidean distance between every pair of points. The rigid transformations include rotations, translations, reflections, or their combination.

在几何中，全等是几何图形之间的一种合同，亦即几何图形之间的一种等价关系。 若两个几何图形的形状、大小完全相同，则称这两个图形是全等的图形。
在数学中，比例是两个非零数量与之间的比较关系

In mathematics, an inverse function (or anti-function) is a function that "reverses" another function.
In geometry, a hypotenuse is the longest side of a right-angled triangle, the side opposite the right angle.

A central angle is the angle that forms when two radii meet at the center of a circle. A central angle (θ) measured in radians tells us how many times the radius fits into the arc.
